section.para: Roaming zones are collections of channels, that are scanned for the strongest signal to maintain connection to a particular network or talk group. Consequently, they group channels with the same talk group.
As an example, consider the following roaming zone:

example.programlisting: roaming: - id: roam1 name: Berlin/Brand channels: [ch3, ch8, ch14, ch18, ch20, ch24, ch26, ch30, ch34, ch38, ch42, ch50]

section.para: This zone has the ID roam1 and the name Berlin/Brand. This group collects all channels that provide access to the Berlin/Brandenburg talk group.

listitem.para: Specifies the ID of the roaming zone. This ID can then be used to refer to this zone. Any unique string is valid here.
Specifies the name of the roaming zone. Any string is valid here.
Specifies the member channels for this roaming zone. This must be a list of references to digital channels.
